sub_title: Director Saxion Research & Graduate School at Saxion University of Applied Sciences

projects.title: Higher Education Drop-out and Completion in Europe (HEDOCE)
projects.description: The overall objective of this study is to provide a consolidated and up-to-date overview of national policies/measures on reducing drop-out and improving completion rates in higher education in Europe and to provide conclusions on the effectiveness of different systemic policies/measures. The study should further provide an assessment of relevance and effectiveness of indicators currently in use and make recommendations on how EU level action can support effective Member State policy-making on this topic.

contributors.headline: Director Saxion Research & Graduate School at Saxion University of Applied Sciences
Research Associate at CHEPS - Center for Higher Education Policy Studies

company.name: Center for Higher Education Policy Studies (CHEPS), University of Twente

profile_positions.description:
Prof. dr. Hans Vossensteyn is the Director of CHEPS since 2011, after a period being the research co-ordinator and deputy director (since 2007).

In the position as director Hans has overall managerial responsibility in terms of staffing, finance, strategy, project acquisition, communication and representation within and outside CHEPS and the University of Twente.
profile_positions.title: Director

profile_positions.description:
Prof. Hans Vossensteyn has participated in a multitude of research projects covering in higher education subjects like funding of teaching and research; student financing and access; internationalisation; indicators; selection and study success; quality assurance and accreditation. Most of these studies had a quantitative and/or qualitative international comparative orientation. Hans has a wide publication record including scientific and policy-oriented publications and he has given a multitude of key-notes and presentations for international conference audiences on a range of higher education topics. Prof. Vossensteyn completed his PhD on student price-responsiveness in 2005 (cum laude – with distinction, the best 5% in the NL).

He has been the project leader and manager of several complex international research projects and consortia, including studies for the European Commission, the European Parliament, the Worlbank and the Dutch Ministry of Education.

As a lecturer Hans is involved in a few courses within the University of Twente's European Public Administration and International Business Administration programs, like Institutional Design and Project Management. He supervises about 8 bachelor and master theses per year.

Hans has also been involved in several training & consultancy projects, e.g. in Mozambique, Uganda, Russia, Ethiopia, Tunesia and Latvia.

Hans served on various advisory boards and strategic committees, like:
- the Committee on the Future Sustainability of Dutch Higher Education (Committee Veerman)
- the Academic Advisory Board of the German DZHW-iFQ
- the Dutch Expert Panel Student Choice123
- the University of Twente Expert Committee Monitoring Education Innovations
- the Ford Foundation’s Advisory Board: International Comparative HE Finance and Accessibility
- the Canada Millennium Scholarships Foundation: Measuring the Effectiveness of Student Aid
- the Programme Committee of the 36th EAIR Forum in Essen, 2014 (also Track Chair).
profile_positions.title: Senior Research Associate and Lecturer

profile_positions.description:
Prof. dr. Hans Vossensteyn is Professor and Programme Leader at the MBA Higher Education and Science Management (HWM) at the Osnabrück University of Applied Sciences since 2007.

As a Programme Leader - together with Prof. Frank Ziegele - Hans is responsible for the organisation of the whole MBA programme, its support staff, accreditation and functioning within the UAS Osnabrück. In this capacity he is also responsible for the HWM participation in and contribution to the Erasmus Mundus MARIHE program (Master in Research and Innovation in Higher Education). 

In the HWM MBA programme Hans teaches various modules, including Foundations of the International Higher Education and Science Systems; Research and Innovation Management; Quality and Process Management; International Relations and Management Game.

In the HWM and MARIHE program Hans supervises about 10 master theses annually.

In Osnabrück Hans organises - together with Prof. Frank Ziegele - the annual HWM Higher Education Conference (HWM Jahrestagung).

Finally Hans is involved in the Deans Course program, an annual professional training program for African and Asean deans, sponsored by the German DAAD.
profile_positions.title: Professor MBA Higher Education and Science Management, Hochschule Osnabrück
